What is Cats the Musical?

Cats is a musical based on T.S. Eliot’s Old Possum’s Book of Practical Cats. The music is composed by Andrew Lloyd Webber and the lyrics are written by Trevor Nunn and Lloyd Webber. The original production opened in 1981 at the New London Theatre in London, and has since been performed in many countries around the world. The musical has been adapted for film, television, and stage.

The show tells the story of a tribe of cats called the Jellicles. Each year, the tribe gathers for a special event called the Jellicle Ball. The cats perform songs and dances to entertain each other, and one of the cats is chosen to ascend to the Heaviside Layer and be reborn into a new Jellicle life.

The musical is known for its elaborate costumes and set design, as well as its complex choreography. It has become one of the most popular musicals of all time, with over 70 million people seeing it in more than 30 countries.

The Cats the Musical Characters

The Jellicles are the main characters in Cats the Musical. They are a tribe of cats who live together in a junkyard. Each cat has their own unique personality and story.

The Jellicles are a close-knit group of friends who rely on each other for support and companionship. They spend their days hunting for food, playing games, and enjoying each other’s company.
